alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Coffee; Giles; Marshall; Maury (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 01 at 1:24AM CDT until April 01 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Marshall County in Middle Tennessee... Southeastern Maury County in Middle Tennessee... Northwestern Coffee County in Middle Tennessee... Northern Giles County in Middle Tennessee... Bedford County in Middle Tennessee... * Until 200 AM CDT. * At 124 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 14 miles southeast of Spring Hill to 8 miles west of Lewisburg to 9 miles northwest of Pulaski, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Shelbyville, Lewisburg, Chapel Hill, Cornersville, Wartrace, Bell Buckle, Lynnville, Normandy, Raus, Belfast, Deason, Farmington and Unionville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 17 and 37. Interstate 24 between mile markers 98 and 104. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for Middle Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for Middle Tennessee.
